results.title: Consumer education: who needs it?
results.creator_credit: Richard Wallace and William C. Crain
results.brief_description: An introduction to consumer problems, especially with respect to supermarkets, car selling, advertising, and credit buying. We see both angry and unconcerned customers. The major problem areas are outlined by people working in the area of consumer protection.

group_works.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset

results.title: Conservation school. No. 4. Soil and water conservation
results.creator_credit: Carl Pryer Jr and United States. Soil Conservation Service
results.brief_description: This film shows briefly how conservation farming methods may prevent further destruction of the nation’s soil and water resources. It emphasises that proper land use is the basis of conservation farming, and shows how several of the best common conservation practices are applied to land, eg contouring, terracing, strip-cropping, cover-cropping, rotation, and tree and grass planting.

results.title: Conservation cropping
results.creator_credit: Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: This compilation tape specifically targets the wheat and sheep area of the Mallee Region and looks at ways that soil erosion can be avoided. The four episodes shown are: “Trash is treasure.”, Blade aid”, “Croppers” and “Mallee Modifiers.

results.title: Conservation and our forests
results.brief_description: Explains why forests are a valuable natural resource. Tells how, through conservation, a continuing supply of wood products can be made available without destroying the forest. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Explains why forests are a valuable natural resource. Tells how, through conservation, a continuing supply of wood products can be made available without destroying the forest. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Conquest of the rivers
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Authority
results.brief_description: Shows through the experiences of a new recruit to the Snowy Mountains Scheme how this great enterprise was carried out. There are dramatic scenes from inside the thirty-seven mile tunnel which is an essential feature of the work. Other views include the blasting of roads, dam-building, and the life of families in the new frontier towns of the Australian Alps. Uses archival footage.

results.title: Conquest
results.creator_credit: Harold L. Gray, Charles F. Banks, Reelcraft Productions and Rural Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: A rural bank manager and his new recruit on horseback visit a grazier who tells the story of claiming the land only to then suffer a drought causing loss to most of his stock. However his bank came to the rescue, providing him with enough money to carry on and buy new stock and equipment. A promotional film for the Rural Bank of New South Wales. Narrated by W. Lane-Bayliff
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold L. Gray, Charles F. Banks, Reelcraft Productions and Rural Bank of New South Wales

results.title: Confusion: diagnosis and management
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
One in a series about techniques for the management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This episode looks in some detail, at the various causes of acute confusion, outlining the basic principles of treatment.
